cards.name: Callous Giant
cards.text: If a source would deal 3 or less damage to Callous Giant, prevent that damage.
cards.flavor: "The invasion has awoken slumbering mountains," noted Urza. "Good. We can use all the help we can get."
cards.originalText: If a source would deal 3 damage or less to Callous Giant, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Chaotic Strike
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during combat after blockers are declared.
Flip a coin. If you win the flip, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can be cast during any of them as long as it's after the beginning of that phase's Declare Blockers Step.

cards.originalText:
Play Chaotic Strike only during combat after blockers are declared.
Choose target creature and flip a coin. If you win the flip, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Collapsing Borders
cards.text: Domain — At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player gains 1 life for each basic land type among lands they control. Then Collapsing Borders deals 3 damage to that player.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player gains 1 life for each basic land type among lands he or she controls. Then Collapsing Borders deals 3 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Crown of Flames
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{R}: Return Crown of Flames to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"All my life I've fought these monsters. Today I finish that fight."
—Barrin
cards.originalText:
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{R}: Return Crown of Flames to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Firebrand Ranger
cards.text: {G}, {T}: You may put a basic land card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: A skilled ranger can glance at the mud on your boots and tell where you last camped.

rulings.text: This does not count as your one land you can normally play each turn.
Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

cards.originalText: {G}, {T}: Put a basic land card from your hand into play.

cards.name: Ghitu Fire
cards.text:
You may cast Ghitu Fire as though it had flash if you pay {2} more to cast it. (You may cast it any time you could cast an instant.)
Ghitu Fire deals X damage to any target.

rulings.text: The extra 2 mana to cast it as an instant does not count as part of the mana cost.

cards.originalText:
You may play Ghitu Fire any time you could play an instant if you pay {2} more to play it.
Ghitu Fire deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Goblin Spy
cards.text: Play with the top card of your library revealed.
cards.flavor:
"Isn't he on our side?"
"Yep."
"Why's he spyin' on us?"
"Don't ask."

rulings.text: The top card of your library isn't in your hand, so you can't suspend it, cycle it, discard it, or activate any of its activated abilities.
If the top card of your library changes while you're casting a spell or activating an ability, the new top card won't be revealed until you finish casting that spell or activating that ability.
When playing with the top card of your library revealed, if an effect tells you to draw several cards, reveal each one before you draw it.

cards.originalText: Play with the top card of your library revealed.

cards.name: Halam Djinn
cards.text:
Haste
Halam Djinn gets -2/-2 as long as red is the most common color among all permanents or is tied for most common.
cards.originalText:
Haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)
Halam Djinn gets -2/-2 as long as red is the most common color among all permanents or is tied for most common.

cards.name: Hooded Kavu
cards.text: {B}: Hooded Kavu gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor: The spread of its hood eclipses all hope.
cards.originalText: {B}: Hooded Kavu can't be blocked this turn except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.

cards.name: Kavu Aggressor
cards.text:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
Kavu Aggressor can't block.
If Kavu Aggressor was kicked, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you play this spell.)
Kavu Aggressor can't block.
If you paid the kicker cost, Kavu Aggressor comes into play with a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Kavu Monarch
cards.text:
Kavu creatures have trample.
Whenever another Kavu enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Kavu Monarch.
cards.flavor: Kavu emerged all across Dominaria, but the first and the strongest came from Yavimaya.

rulings.text: Does give itself Trample, but does not give itself a +1/+1 counter.

cards.originalText:
All Kavu have trample.
Whenever another Kavu comes into play, put a +1/+1 counter on Kavu Monarch.

cards.name: Kavu Runner
cards.text: Kavu Runner has haste as long as no opponent controls a white or blue creature.
cards.originalText: Kavu Runner has haste as long as no opponent controls a white or blue creature. (It may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Kavu Scout
cards.text: Domain — Kavu Scout gets +1/+0 for each basic land type among lands you control.
cards.flavor: The kavu evolved for centuries deep inside Dominaria, and some can draw from its strength.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: Kavu Scout gets +1/+0 for each basic land type among lands you control.

cards.name: Lightning Dart
cards.text: Lightning Dart deals 1 damage to target creature. If that creature is white or blue, Lightning Dart deals 4 damage to it instead.
cards.flavor: Broken and punctured by dozens of Phyrexian portals, the angry sky began to spit lightning back at the world.
cards.originalText: Lightning Dart deals 1 damage to target creature. If that creature is white or blue, Lightning Dart deals 4 damage to it instead.

cards.name: Loafing Giant
cards.text: Whenever Loafing Giant attacks or blocks, put the top card of your library into your graveyard. If that card is a land card, prevent all combat damage Loafing Giant would deal this turn.
cards.flavor: "Forget it. I'm not getting up today."

rulings.text: If it somehow blocks multiple creatures in a single combat, the triggered ability only triggers once.

cards.originalText: Whenever Loafing Giant attacks or blocks, put the top card of your library into your graveyard. If that card is a land card, prevent all combat damage that Loafing Giant would deal this turn.

cards.name: Mages' Contest
cards.text: You and target spell's controller bid life. You start the bidding with a bid of 1. In turn order, each player may top the high bid. The bidding ends if the high bid stands. The high bidder loses life equal to the high bid. If you win the bidding, counter that spell.
cards.originalText: You and target spell's controller bid life. You start the bidding with a high bid of 1. In turn order, each player may top the high bid. The bidding ends when the high bid stands. The highest bidder loses life equal to the high bid. If you win the bidding, counter that spell.

cards.name: Maniacal Rage
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.
cards.flavor: "Remember me?" Tahngarth roared. "Now I'll repay you for my stay on Rath"
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.

cards.name: Obliterate
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and lands. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: For his family, Barrin made a funeral pyre of Tolaria.

rulings.text: Counterspells can be cast that target it, but when they resolve they simply don't counter it since it can't be countered.

cards.originalText:
Obliterate can't be countered.
Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and lands. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Overload
cards.text:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Destroy target artifact if its converted mana cost is 2 or less. If this spell was kicked, destroy that artifact if its converted mana cost is 5 or less instead.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you play this spell.)
Destroy target artifact if its converted mana cost is 2 or less. If you paid the kicker cost, destroy that artifact if its converted mana cost is 5 or less instead.

cards.name: Pouncing Kavu
cards.text:
Kicker {2}{R} (You may pay an additional {2}{R} as you cast this spell.)
First strike
If Pouncing Kavu was kicked, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with haste.

rulings.text: If the Pouncing Kavu is kicked, it enters the battlefield with haste and will keep this ability until it leaves the battlefield.

Kicker {2}{R} (You may pay an additional {2}{R} as you play this spell.)
First strike
If you paid the kicker cost, Pouncing Kavu comes into play with two +1/+1 counters on it and has haste. (It may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.text: {2}: Target black or green creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

cards.originalText: {2}: Target black or green creature gains haste until end of turn. (It may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Rogue Kavu
cards.text: Whenever Rogue Kavu attacks alone, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "I know how this one feels," said Urza. "It's not like others of its kind and has been shunned for its differences."
cards.originalText: Whenever Rogue Kavu attacks alone, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ruby Leech
cards.text:
First strike
Red spells you cast cost {R} more to cast.
cards.flavor:
"Its gems didn't stop pulsating until they were completely removed."
—Tolarian research notes
cards.originalText:
First strike
Red spells you play cost {R} more to play.

cards.text:
Kicker {G} (You may pay an additional {G} as you cast this spell.)
Creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn. If this spell was kicked, they get +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Only affects creatures you control when this spell resolves.

cards.originalText:
Kicker {G} (You may pay an additional {G} as you play this spell.)
Creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn. If you paid the kicker cost, they get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Scarred Puma
cards.text: Scarred Puma can't attack unless a black or green creature also attacks.
cards.flavor: It's not eager to lose the other eye.

rulings.text: It means "a black or green creature other than itself attacks".

cards.originalText: Scarred Puma can't attack unless a black or green creature also attacks.

cards.name: Scorching Lava
cards.text:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you cast this spell.)
Scorching Lava deals 2 damage to any target. If this spell was kicked, that creature can't be regenerated this turn and if it would die this turn, exile it instead.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you play this spell.)
Scorching Lava deals 2 damage to target creature or player. If you paid the kicker cost, that creature can't be regenerated this turn and if it would be put into a graveyard this turn, remove it from the game instead.

cards.name: Searing Rays
cards.text: Choose a color. Searing Rays deals damage to each player equal to the number of creatures of that color that player controls.
cards.flavor:
"This is a battle of pawns, for the highest stakes imaginable."
—Urza

rulings.text: You choose the color on resolution. Your opponent does not get to respond between the color choice and the damage happening. They need to use any damage prevention they want before you choose a color.

cards.originalText: Choose a color. Searing Rays deals damage to each player equal to the number of creatures of that color that player controls.

cards.name: Shivan Emissary
cards.text:
Kicker {1}{B} (You may pay an additional {1}{B} as you cast this spell.)
When Shivan Emissary enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {1}{B} (You may pay an additional {1}{B} as you play this spell.)
When Shivan Emissary comes into play, if you paid the kicker cost, destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Shivan Harvest
cards.text: {1}{R}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonbasic land.
cards.flavor:
"The blood of your ancestors ran heavy on this soil. Now it's your turn to sacrifice for the glory of Shiv."
—Viashino heretic
cards.originalText: {1}{R}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonbasic land.

cards.name: Skittish Kavu
cards.text: Skittish Kavu gets +1/+1 as long as no opponent controls a white or blue creature.
cards.flavor: Fierce when roused, this breed of kavu is easily distracted by a strong voice or melodic tune.
cards.originalText: Skittish Kavu gets +1/+1 as long as no opponent controls a white or blue creature.

cards.name: Skizzik
cards.text:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you cast this spell.)
Trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, if Skizzik wasn't kicked, sacrifice it.

rulings.text: Skizzik's ability checks at each end step whether it was kicked while it was being cast. You don't have to pay its kicker cost each turn (and can't do so, even if you really want to kick it again).

cards.originalText:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you play this spell.)
Trample; haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)
At end of turn, sacrifice Skizzik unless the kicker cost was paid.

cards.name: Slimy Kavu
cards.text: {T}: Target land becomes a Swamp until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Its slime liquefies the ground as efficiently as its fangs shred prey.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target land becomes a swamp until end of turn.

cards.name: Stand or Fall
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, separate all creatures defending player controls into two piles. Only creatures in the pile of that player's choice can block this turn.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your combat phase, separate all creatures defending player controls into two face-up piles. Only creatures in the pile of that player's choice may block this turn.

cards.name: Stun
cards.text:
Target creature can't block this turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"They certainly are well protected. Too bad for them they're not well balanced."
—Sisay

rulings.text: Must be used before blockers are declared in order to affect blocking decisions. You can't wait to see what your opponent declares and then try to stop them.
You can use it after combat or even on a creature which can't possibly block this turn because it's that player's turn to attack, but it generally has no effect other than to let you draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Target creature can't block this turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Tectonic Instability
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, tap all lands its controller controls.
cards.flavor:
"Think of the problems we'll face if you uproot entire continents," said Urza.
"I have," replied Teferi, "but the alternative is worse."
cards.originalText: Whenever a land comes into play, tap all lands its controller controls.

cards.name: Thunderscape Apprentice
cards.text:
{B}, {T}: Target player loses 1 life.
{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
{B}, {T}: Target player loses 1 life.
{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Thunderscape Master
cards.text:
{B}{B}, {T}: Target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
{G}{G}, {T}: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
{B}{B}, {T}: Target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
{G}{G}, {T}: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Tribal Flames
cards.text: Domain — Tribal Flames deals X damage to any target, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.
cards.flavor:
"Fire is the universal language."
—Jhoira, master artificer

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: Tribal Flames deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.

cards.name: Turf Wound
cards.text:
Target player can't play lands this turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"I can't imagine how anyone lives in Shiv, let alone why they choose to stay."
—Sisay

rulings.text: Stops the player from playing a land, but not from putting a land onto the battlefield using a spell or ability.

cards.originalText:
Target player can't play land cards this turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Urza's Rage
cards.text:
Kicker {8}{R} (You may pay an additional {8}{R} as you cast this spell.)
This spell can't be countered.
Urza's Rage deals 3 damage to any target. If this spell was kicked, instead it deals 10 damage to that permanent or player and the damage can't be prevented.

rulings.text: This spell has a self-replacement in it . This means that if Urza's Rage is kicked, the 3 damage is replaced with 10 unpreventable damage before any other replacements can be applied. For example, you can't use Healing Salve to prevent the 3 damage before it gets changed.
You can target this spell with spells and abilities, so you can change its target. Those spells and abilities just can't counter it.
The damage is unpreventable, but it can be affected by replacement effects.
Counterspells can be cast that target it, but when they resolve they simply don't counter it since it can't be countered.

cards.originalText:
Kicker {8}{R} (You may pay an additional {8}{R} as you play this spell.)
Urza's Rage can't be countered by spells or abilities.
Urza's Rage deals 3 damage to target creature or player. If you paid the kicker cost, instead Urza's Rage deals 10 damage to that creature or player and the damage can't be prevented.

cards.name: Viashino Grappler
cards.text: {G}: Viashino Grappler gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"They've returned for the mana rig, but it no longer belongs to them."
—Viashino bey
cards.originalText: {G}: Viashino Grappler gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Zap
cards.text:
Zap deals 1 damage to any target.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "All this time I thought Squee was useless," chuckled Sisay. "Who knew he'd be such a good shot?"
cards.originalText:
Zap deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Aggressive Urge
cards.text:
Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: The power of the wild, concentrated in a single charge.

rulings.text: If the target creature is an illegal target by the time Aggressive Urge tries to resolve, the spell doesn't resolve. You won't draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Bind
cards.text:
Counter target activated ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"The battlefield is cluttered enough. Be still."
—Multani, maro-sorcerer

rulings.text: Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
Counter target activated ability. (Mana abilities can't be countered.)
Draw a card.

cards.name: Blurred Mongoose
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor:
"The mongoose blew out its candle and was asleep in bed before the room went dark."
—Llanowar fable

rulings.text: It can be targeted while on the stack. Shroud only works while it is on the battlefield.
Counterspells can be cast that target it, but when they resolve they simply don't counter it since it can't be countered.

cards.originalText:
Blurred Mongoose can't be countered.
Blurred Mongoose can't be the target of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Canopy Surge
cards.text:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Canopy Surge deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player. If this spell was kicked, it deals 4 damage to each creature with flying and each player instead.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you play this spell.)
Canopy Surge deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player. If you paid the kicker cost, Canopy Surge deals 4 damage to each creature with flying and each player instead.

cards.name: Elfhame Sanctuary
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, you skip your draw step this turn and shuffle your library.

rulings.text: If you have more than one of these on the battlefield, you get to use them all and you don't skip multiple draw steps.
The "if you do" means "if you search your library". You get to skip your draw step and shuffle your deck even if you don't find (or choose not to find) a basic land.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, skip your draw step this turn and shuffle your library.

cards.name: Elvish Champion
cards.text: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor:
"For what are leaves but countless blades
To fight a countless foe on high."
—Skyshroud hymn

rulings.text: It affects Elves controlled by all players, not just yours.
This card is now an Elf but has been reworded so that it does not give itself the bonus.

cards.originalText: All Elves get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a forest.)

cards.name: Explosive Growth
cards.text:
Kicker {5} (You may pay an additional {5} as you cast this spell.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If this spell was kicked, that creature gets +5/+5 until end of turn instead.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {5} (You may pay an additional {5} as you play this spell.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If you paid the kicker cost, that creature gets +5/+5 until end of turn instead.

cards.name: Fertile Ground
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: As Phyrexians descended, Multani paused to reflect on the beauty that might never be seen again.
cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any color to his or her mana pool.

cards.name: Harrow
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for up to two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: No spot in nature is truly barren.

rulings.text: The sacrifice of a land is part of the cost of casting Harrow. You can't pay this cost more than once to get a multiple effect.
The two lands do not count toward your normal one land you can play each turn.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Harrow, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Jade Leech
cards.text: Green spells you cast cost {G} more to cast.
cards.flavor:
"It took magic to extract one of the stones and five people to carry it."
—Tolarian research notes
cards.originalText: Green spells you play cost {G} more to play.

cards.name: Kavu Chameleon
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
{G}: Kavu Chameleon becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"They weren't part of my plan, but Gaea insisted."
—Urza

rulings.text: The new color replaces all previous colors.
Counterspells can be cast that target it, but when they resolve they simply don't counter it since it can't be countered.

cards.originalText:
Kavu Chameleon can't be countered.
{G}: Kavu Chameleon becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Kavu Climber
cards.text: When Kavu Climber enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor: The appearance of the first kavu surprised Multani. As they continued to emerge, he no longer had any doubts about Yavimaya's ability to defend herself.
cards.originalText: When Kavu Climber comes into play, draw a card.

cards.name: Kavu Lair
cards.text: Whenever a creature with power 4 or greater enters the battlefield, its controller draws a card.
cards.flavor: As a dark rain of Phyrexians fell from the sky, fountains of kavu erupted from the ground.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature with power 4 or greater comes into play, its controller draws a card.

cards.name: Kavu Titan
cards.text:
Kicker {2}{G} (You may pay an additional {2}{G} as you cast this spell.)
If Kavu Titan was kicked, it enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it and with trample.

rulings.text: If the Kavu Titan was kicked, it enters the battlefield with trample and will keep this ability until it leaves the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Kicker {2}{G} (You may pay an additional {2}{G} as you play this spell.)
If you paid the kicker cost, Kavu Titan comes into play with three +1/+1 counters on it and has trample.

cards.name: Llanowar Cavalry
cards.text: {W}: Llanowar Cavalry gains vigilance until end of turn.
cards.flavor: For the first time, elves welcomed Benalish soldiers into the forest with something other than arrows.
cards.originalText: {W}: Attacking doesn't cause Llanowar Cavalry to tap this turn.

cards.name: Llanowar Elite
cards.text:
Kicker {8} (You may pay an additional {8} as you cast this spell.)
Trample
If Llanowar Elite was kicked, it enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {8} (You may pay an additional {8} as you play this spell.)
Trample
If you paid the kicker cost, Llanowar Elite comes into play with five +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.name: Llanowar Vanguard
cards.text: {T}: Llanowar Vanguard gets +0/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Llanowar rallied around Eladamri's banner and united in his name.
cards.originalText: {T}: Llanowar Vanguard gets +0/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Might Weaver
cards.text: {2}: Target red or white creature gains trample until end of turn. (If the creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
cards.flavor: "Let my strength harden your resolve."
cards.originalText: {2}: Target red or white creature gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.
cards.flavor: "The world calls and I answer."
cards.originalText:
Trample
Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.

cards.name: Nomadic Elf
cards.text: {1}{G}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: "I've journeyed across Dominaria. Phyrexians are everywhere. Plague is everywhere. There's no place left to hide."
cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Pincer Spider
cards.text:
Kicker {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell.)
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
If Pincer Spider was kicked, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you play this spell.)
Pincer Spider may block as though it had flying.
If you paid the kicker cost, Pincer Spider comes into play with a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Pulse of Llanowar
cards.text: If a basic land you control is tapped for mana, it produces mana of a color of your choice instead of any other type.
cards.flavor:
"Gaea's memory is eternal, and she exists in all things."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

rulings.text: This does not change the amount of mana gained. It just makes all the mana generated by the basic land be of a single color of your choice.
You can choose a different color each time a basic land is tapped.
You can choose the same color or mana the land would normally produce.

cards.originalText: If a basic land you control is tapped for mana, it produces mana of any one color instead of its normal type.

cards.name: Quirion Elves
cards.text:
As Quirion Elves enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{T}: Add {G}.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color.
cards.originalText:
As Quirion Elves comes into play, choose a color.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Quirion Sentinel
cards.text: When Quirion Sentinel enters the battlefield, add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: All elvenkind stood against Phyrexia. The Quirion nation deployed its most spiritual adepts, who wielded the power of their native soil.

rulings.text: This is not a mana ability. It uses the stack, and can be responded to.
You get the mana whether you want it or not. If you don't spend it, it will disappear at the end of the current step (or phase).

cards.originalText: When Quirion Sentinel comes into play, add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Quirion Trailblazer
cards.text: When Quirion Trailblazer enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "All that matters is the path ahead."

rulings.text: The land does not count toward your normal limit of playing one land per turn.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: When Quirion Trailblazer comes into play, you may search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play tapped. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Restock
cards.text: Return two target cards from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Restock.
cards.flavor:
"We hid such stockpiles all over Rath. We should continue that practice here."
—Lin Sivvi
cards.originalText: Return two target cards from your graveyard to your hand. Remove Restock from the game.

cards.name: Rooting Kavu
cards.text: When Rooting Kavu dies, you may exile it. If you do, shuffle all creature cards from your graveyard into your library.
cards.originalText: When Rooting Kavu is put into a graveyard from play, you may remove Rooting Kavu from the game. If you do, shuffle all creature cards from your graveyard into your library.

cards.name: Saproling Infestation
cards.text: Whenever a player kicks a spell, you create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
cards.flavor: "My army took centuries to gather," remarked Urza. "Yavimaya seems to conjure hers out of thin air."
cards.originalText: Whenever a player pays a kicker cost, you put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play.

cards.name: Saproling Symbiosis
cards.text:
You may cast Saproling Symbiosis as though it had flash if you pay {2} more to cast it. (You may cast it any time you could cast an instant.)
Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token for each creature you control.
cards.originalText:
You may play Saproling Symbiosis any time you could play an instant if you pay {2} more to play it.
Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play for each creature you control.

cards.name: Scouting Trek
cards.text: Search your library for any number of basic land cards. Reveal those cards, then shuffle your library and put them on top of it.
cards.flavor:
"I have chosen my path. Who will walk it with me?"
—Eladamri
cards.originalText: Search your library for any number of basic land cards, reveal them, and set them aside. Shuffle your library, then put those cards on top of it in any order.

cards.name: Serpentine Kavu
cards.text: {R}: Serpentine Kavu gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Under Yavimaya's peaceful facade beat the hearts of many savage beasts.
cards.originalText: {R}: Serpentine Kavu gains haste until end of turn. (It may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Sulam Djinn
cards.text:
Trample
Sulam Djinn gets -2/-2 as long as green is the most common color among all permanents or is tied for most common.
cards.originalText:
Trample
Sulam Djinn gets -2/-2 as long as green is the most common color among all permanents or is tied for most common.

cards.name: Tangle
cards.text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Each attacking creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor: Gaea battles rampant death with abundant life.

rulings.text: It identifies the creatures that are not going to untap at the time this spell resolves.

cards.originalText:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Attacking creatures don't untap during their controllers' next untap steps.

cards.name: Thicket Elemental
cards.text:
Kicker {1}{G} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} as you cast this spell.)
When Thicket Elemental enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, you may reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. If you do, put that card onto the battlefield and shuffle all other cards revealed this way into your library.

rulings.text: The "if you do" means "if you choose to reveal cards". You still shuffle if you have no creature card in your library.

cards.originalText:
Kicker {1}{G} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} as you play this spell.)
When Thicket Elemental comes into play, if you paid the kicker cost, you may reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. If you do, put that card into play and shuffle all other cards revealed this way into your library.

cards.name: Thornscape Apprentice
cards.text:
{R}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
cards.originalText:
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
{R}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Thornscape Master
cards.text:
{R}{R}, {T}: Thornscape Master deals 2 damage to target creature.
{W}{W}, {T}: Target creature gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
{R}{R}, {T}: Thornscape Master deals 2 damage to target creature.
{W}{W}, {T}: Target creature gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Tranquility
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.
cards.flavor: The plagues robbed Dominaria of all but its dreams. Eladamri hoped dreams were enough.
cards.originalText: Destroy all enchantments.

cards.name: Treefolk Healer
cards.text: {2}{W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: Protected by druids for untold centuries, the forest began to return the favor.
cards.originalText: {2}{W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Utopia Tree
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: The fruit of this fabled tree takes on the flavor of whatever food you love most.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Verdeloth the Ancient
cards.text:
Kicker {X} (You may pay an additional {X} as you cast this spell.)
Saproling creatures and other Treefolk creatures get +1/+1.
When Verdeloth the Ancient enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, create X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.

rulings.text: Verdeloth won't give himself +1/+1 unless he somehow becomes a Saproling.

cards.originalText:
Kicker {X} (You may pay an additional {X} as you play this spell.)
All other Treefolk and all Saprolings get +1/+1.
When Verdeloth the Ancient comes into play, if you paid the kicker cost, put X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens into play.

cards.name: Verduran Emissary
cards.text:
Kicker {1}{R} (You may pay an additional {1}{R} as you cast this spell.)
When Verduran Emissary enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {1}{R} (You may pay an additional {1}{R} as you play this spell.)
When Verduran Emissary comes into play, if you paid the kicker cost, destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Vigorous Charge
cards.text:
Kicker {W} (You may pay an additional {W} as you cast this spell.)
Target creature gains trample until end of turn. Whenever that creature deals combat damage this turn, if this spell was kicked, you gain life equal to that damage.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {W} (You may pay an additional {W} as you play this spell.)
Target creature gains trample until end of turn. Whenever that creature deals combat damage this turn, if you paid the kicker cost, you gain life equal to that damage.

cards.name: Wallop
cards.text: Destroy target blue or black creature with flying.
cards.flavor: In Yavimaya, flying low to join a battle can be a costly mistake.
cards.originalText: Destroy target blue or black creature with flying.

cards.name: Wandering Stream
cards.text: Domain — You gain 2 life for each basic land type among lands you control.
cards.flavor:
"Dominaria touches us all."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: You gain 2 life for each basic land type among lands you control.

cards.name: Whip Silk
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
{G}: Return Whip Silk to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Llanowar forges weapons of steel. Yavimaya grows her weapons within.
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature may block as though it had flying.
{G}: Return Whip Silk to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Absorb
cards.text: Counter target spell. You gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: "Your presumption is your downfall."

rulings.text: If cast targeting a spell that can't be countered, the life gain still happens, but that spell is not countered.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell. You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Aether Rift
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, discard a card at random. If you discard a creature card this way, return it from your graveyard to the battlefield unless any player pays 5 life.

rulings.text: First, the card is discarded. Then, in turn order, each player is given the option to pay 5 life. Then, if no player paid 5 life, the card is put onto the battlefield from the graveyard.
The card is actually discard, so anything which triggers on a discard will trigger. Such abilities will wait to go on the stack until after this ability has completely resolved.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, discard a card at random from your hand. If you discard a creature card this way, put that card into play unless any player pays 5 life.

cards.name: Angelic Shield
cards.text:
Creatures you control get +0/+1.
Sacrifice Angelic Shield: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"If only an angel's wings could shelter us all."
—Barrin

rulings.text: Angelic Shield goes to the graveyard when you activate the ability, but the targeted creature does not get returned until the ability resolves. All your creatures lose the bonus while the ability is on the stack which may result in the targeted creature being destroyed before the return can take effect.

cards.originalText:
Creatures you control get +0/+1.
Sacrifice Angelic Shield: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Armadillo Cloak
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has trample.
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor:
"Don't laugh. It works."
—Yavimaya ranger

rulings.text: While Armadillo Cloak's last ability is similar to lifelink, it isn't lifelink—it's a normal triggered ability. If a creature you control with lifelink wears an Armadillo Cloak and deals damage, first you'll gain that much life for lifelink, and then Armadillo Cloak's triggered ability is put onto the stack. This also means that multiple instances of Armadillo Cloak's triggered ability do trigger separately.
If Armadillo Cloak enchants a creature you don't control, you'll gain life when it deals damage, as long as that damage hasn't already caused you to lose the game.

cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has trample.
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

cards.name: Armored Guardian
cards.text:
{1}{W}{W}: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
{1}{U}{U}: Armored Guardian gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

rulings.text: You can activate the ability that grants shroud in response to this card being targeted by a spell or ability. If you do so, then (if this is the spell or abilities only target) the spell or ability won't resolve since this card will now be an illegal target.

cards.originalText:
{1}{W}{W}: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
{1}{U}{U}: Armored Guardian can't be the target of spells or abilities this turn.

cards.name: Artifact Mutation
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. Create X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens, where X is that artifact's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"From shards and splinters I call forth my living horde."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

rulings.text: This spell is countered and you get no Saprolings if the artifact is an illegal target on resolution.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. Put X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens into play, where X is its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Aura Mutation
cards.text: Destroy target enchantment. Create X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens, where X is that enchantment's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"Life can be found in all things, even things unnatural."
—Multani, maro-sorcerer

rulings.text: This spell doesn't resolve and you get no Saprolings if the enchantment is an illegal target on resolution.

cards.originalText: Destroy target enchantment. Put X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens into play, where X is its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Aura Shards
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: Gaea forged her soldiers into self-wielding weapons that struck down all impurities.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature comes into play under your control, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Backlash
cards.text: Tap target untapped creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to its controller.
cards.flavor: Darigaaz decided his foe would be more useful as a weapon.

rulings.text: Being untapped is a targeting restriction. If the target is tapped before this spell resolves, then this spell doesn't resolve.

cards.originalText: Tap target untapped creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to its controller.

cards.name: Barrin's Spite
cards.text: Choose two target creatures controlled by the same player. Their controller chooses and sacrifices one of them. Return the other to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Only vengeance matters now."
—Barrin

rulings.text: The player chooses which one to sacrifice as the spell resolves. If only one of the targets is still legal at that time, then the player must choose that one to sacrifice.

cards.originalText: Choose two target creatures controlled by one player. That player chooses and sacrifices one of them. Return the other to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Blazing Specter
cards.text:
Flying, haste
Whenever Blazing Specter deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.
cards.originalText:
Flying; haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)
Whenever Blazing Specter deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card from his or her hand.

cards.name: Captain Sisay
cards.text: {T}: Search your library for a legendary card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Her leadership forged the Weatherlight's finest crew.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: {T}: Search your library for a Legend or legendary card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Cauldron Dance
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during combat.
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Return it to your hand at the beginning of the next end step.
You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Its controller sacrifices it at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: If the targeted creature card in the graveyard is removed before resolution, this spell won't resolve since its only target will be invalid.

You can cast this spell when you have no creature card in your hand. If this happens, simply ignore that part of the spell. You still put the graveyard creature onto the battlefield and still return it to your hand at the beginning of the end step.
You must have a creature in your graveyard to cast this spell since it requires a valid target.

cards.originalText:
Play Cauldron Dance only during combat.
Return target creature card from your graveyard to play. That creature gains haste. Return it to your hand at end of turn. 
Put a creature card from your hand into play. That creature gains haste. Put it into your graveyard at end of turn.
